instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> have orange light. Does not boot or give a fan spin, but does smc reset. only issue i have found is L7560 jumps from around 3v to 0 (like it turns off and on very quickly)

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 8.59v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
how long is that "quickly"? 
Could be bad <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> (you should also check if both gates are ok, sorry, you need an oscilloscope for that),
check <RESISTOR>R7516</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7546</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7588</CAPACITOR>
also, if you're checking voltages with an oscilloscope, you're seeing "wobbly" voltage almost everywere

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Thanks <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> was right on the money!
